availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Pennebaker Boone (Louisville attorney and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Harrison County, Indiana, native. Son of Samuel Boone. Married to Eliza Rowan Harney. Father of John R. Boone, Ann M. Boone, and Samuel Boone. Teacher in Harrison County. County Clerk in Harrison County. Attorney in Harrison County. Attorney in Louisville from 1836 to 1861. Member of the Union Democratic State Central committee. Member of the Louisville Board of Aldermen. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861. Served as lieutenant colonel in the 28th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from November 6, 1861 to January 3, 1862, and colonel from January 3, 1862, to June 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 438B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 637.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 260, 911.
United States Adjutant General’s Office, _ Official Army Register of The Volunteer Force of The United States Army for the Years 1861, '62, '63, '64, '65_, vol. 4, (Washington, D.C.: 1865), 1282.
History of the Ohio Falls Cities and their Counties, vol. 1 (Cleveland, OH: L.A. Williams & Co., 1882), 496c-496e.
Theodore Johnson, “William P. Boone and J. Rowan Boone,” _The Magazine of Western History, 9:(November 1888-April 1889), 715-18.
